questions.text: The Dashwood sisters see people...dead people. Regency lushness enhances this psychological mind game drama.
questions.explanation:
The Sixth Sense and Sensibility.

	"Sense and Sensibility" was an old-fashioned Regency romance about a practical sister and a romantic one.

questions.text: Naked Englishmen from Sheffield encounter vorpal bunnies, shrubberies, and the Knights who say "Ni."
questions.correct: The Full Monty Python and the Holy Grail
questions.explanation:
The Full Monty Python and the Holy Grail.

	"Monty Python and the Holy Grail" is regarded by many people as the finest comedy ever made. My husband can quote the entire movie by heart!

questions.text: New Orleans detective Remy McSwain gets into trouble while investigating a pair of long-haired bikers heading for Mardi Gras.
questions.explanation:
The Big Easy Rider.

	"Easy Rider" has long been a counterculture favorite, featuring music of the 60's.

questions.text: James Bond and an autistic sidekick watch Judge Wapner and track down the killer of a scientist.
questions.correct: Rain Man with the Golden Gun
questions.explanation:
Rain Man with the Golden Gun.

	"Rain Man" introduced millions to the world of autism.

questions.text: Princess Aurora and Belle have to guess- who is the werewolf among the Disney crowd?
questions.correct: Sleeping Beauty and the Beast Must Die
questions.explanation:
Sleeping Beauty and the Beast Must Die.

	"The Beast Must Die" was a 1970's werewolf mystery where the characters had to guess which person among them was a werewolf.

	"Blade Runner" was one of the first films of the "cyberpunk revolution"- science fiction that is dark and technologically intricate.
